column2: This mysterious staff is a source of great magic. Hailing from beyond our plane of existence, an arcane being of immense power, Aluneth, is bound within this staff.

The vampiric Nathrezim forged this sword, a terrible weapon which brings violence, sickness and death with every swing. Apocalypse gained a terrible reputation in the hands of a Tirisguard mage who could not control its destructive energies.
This sword has been forged from a crystal of pure light energy. Any evil being faced with this holy weapon will be turned to ash by its purifying light.

Atiesh, the greatstaff of the Guardian is a powerful staff passed down through the line of the Guardians of Tirisfal. The staff was born from the "seed of hate" and grants its wielder "unending power".
This spear was handed down through many generations of the Bloodhoof line. Each owner carved his own major history into the shaft before passing it on to the next generation.
The spellbook written by Medivh. Truly an artifact of great magical power, particularly when it comes to portal and teleportation magic.
Void magic emanates from this strange crystal, but somewhere in the depths of it you feel the presence of the Light.
Forged on Draenor in a lava basin and passed down through generations, this mighty hammer harnesses the power of the elements and is capable of dealing a devastating blow to any enemy.
The Eye of Sargeras is a powerful gem-like artifact previously used by the Avatar of Sargeras. This magical stone thrums with demonic energies.

This runeblade, known also as Flamestrike, is a family relic of the Sunstrider dynasty. Anasterian Sunstrider wielded it against the Amani trolls after the founding of Quel'Thalas, having originally inherited it from Dath'Remar.

This sword, etched with dark runes, was forged by the nathrezim. The souls of living creatures killed by Frostmourne remain trapped within the blade forever, which is adept in cutting flesh, metal and soul alike.
The Twilight's Hammer, also known as the Hammer of Twilight, is forged with elementium and the power of the Old Gods. It was created as a symbol of the Twilight Hammer cult's power.
This ancient relic of the Night Elves is said to hold the power to call the spirits of all Night Elves.
This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to Gavinrad by Alonsus Faol, who challenged him to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.

This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to [Prev.GetDynName] by [libram_giver.GetDynName], who challenged [Prev.GetHerHim] to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.
This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to Saidan Dathrohan by Alonsus Faol, who challenged him to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.

This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to [Prev.GetDynName] by [libram_giver.GetDynName], who challenged [Prev.GetHerHim] to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.
This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to Uther by Alonsus Faol, who challenged him to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.

This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to [Prev.GetDynName] by [libram_giver.GetDynName], who challenged [Prev.GetHerHim] to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.
This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to Turalyon by Alonsus Faol, who challenged him to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.

This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to [Prev.GetDynName] by [libram_giver.GetDynName], who challenged [Prev.GetHerHim] to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.
This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to Tirion Fordring by Alonsus Faol, who challenged him to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.

This libram is among the church's most ancient relics. It was given to [Prev.GetDynName] by [libram_giver.GetDynName], who challenged [Prev.GetHerHim] to become the living embodiment of what this holy tome represents.
Crafted by the demon lord Kil'jaeden, this orb was meant for his champion to aid them in destroying the Lich King.

This unholy scepter once belonged to the dark titan Sargeras. After his fall, it lay in the depths of his tomb for centuries. It has the power to rip open dimensional gateways between worlds, if placed in gifted hands.
The scythe of Elune is an ancient artifact covered with mystical runes consisting of Goldrinn's fang and the staff of Elune.
Serathil was crafted on Draenor for Kash'drakor and used in the Blood River war that ended with the annihilation of the Dark Scar clan.
The Shadow Orb is a magical artifact created by the orcish Shadow Council and presented to Gul'dan. Excessive use of this powerful tool can drive weaker souls into madness.
The Skull of Gul'dan is a powerful demonic artifact created from the skull of the orc warlock Gul'dan.
Sulfuras is the mighty weapon of Ragnaros, the fire lord, forged from red elementium. Complicated runes cover the surface of the weapon like flowing lava.
Tyr himself wielded this weapon in countless battles against the enemies of the Titans. He sacrificed his life to cover the escape of his comrades.
Thunderfury, the blessed Blade of the Windseeker.

The legendary sword of Ignaeus Trollbane, the great general of the Arathorian Empire, which later became the regalia of the Trollbane family. The glory of the sword lies in its ability to deal with any troll with just a couple of strokes.
This book contains inscrutable knowledge about the Void and the Old Gods. The pages are made of the flesh and skin of faithful followers, who gave their lives for the sake of the will of their lords.
Xal'atath, Blade of the Black Empire
Nobody knows exactly when this blade was created, but according to legend it was used for sacrifices in ancient times. It drips with void magic and its quiet whispering attacks those with weak minds.
These twin-blades formerly belonged to Azzinoth, the leader of the doomguard, who was slain by Illidan 10,000 years ago. They are usually connected, but can be seperated and used as two weapons.

A massive axe wielded by Grommash Hellscream of the Warsong Clan. It is permanently stained with the blood of the warrior's fallen enemies. Small holes and notches that dot the blade make it "sing" when swung.
This humongous warblade belongs to Archimonde the Defiler, Lord of the Burning Legion. Countless worlds were conquered by the might of this blade and its owner.
Now a cherished relic of the Trollbanes', which, according to legend, Ignaeus Trollbane drank from when he feasted with the great king Thoradin himself after the defeat of the Amani Empire.

This unique shield was carved from the flattened crown of a white dragon's skull. The bone has been hardened and enhanced with an intricate steel framework interlaced with unidentifiable runes from an unknown maker. Handles were added, turning the skull into a powerful shield.
This two-handed hammer has been wielded by the Lightbringer since he was named one of the first paladins. The diamond hammer with mahogany handle is decorated with a gold emblem of the silver hand.
The legendary orc-slaying hammer, crafted out of a massive block of dark iron, with dwarven runes of power carved into its surface.
These pipes, made according to a design by Khadgar, have a handle of gnarled wood and a deep bowl of yellowed bone.
An unholy orb imbued with the magic of the scourge, crafted to bring the mortal knights to their knees.
The prismatic blade was forged by the five dragon flights together with the night elves and was wielded by the Dawnseeker family against trolls and the Scourge.
This robe, imbued with powerful magic, belongs to Drak'thul, disciple of Gul'dan and warlock of the Stormreaver clan.
Drek'thar's Spellbook contains spells from Kirin Tor magices killed in battle. This ragged looking volume is covered with a carved wooden shell that remains sealed by interlocking teeth.
When someone holds this book, dark whispers creep into the corner of their mind...
When someone holds this book, dark whispers creep into the corner of their mind...

After regaining her physical form, the Dark Lady seized this bow infused with powerful dark magic.
A Steamy Romance Novel: Blue Moon
A Steamy Romance Novel: Savage Passions
A Steamy Romance Novel: Forbidden Love
A Steamy Romance Novel: Big Brass Bombs
A Steamy Romance Novel: Waves of Desire
A Steamy Romance Novel: Hot and Misty
A Steamy Romance Novel: Northern Exposure
A wooden flute set in gold. It is unclear whether the flutes of accuracy were named in honour of the elven ranger Alleria or whether she was involved in her invention.

The Crown of Stromgarde, a family relic of the Trollbane dynasty to which the first king of Stromgarde was crowned, after the descendants of the great king Thoradin abdicated the throne under the pressure of the aristocracy of the collapsing empire.
This sword, the so called "blade of Stormwind", is a massive two-handed runeblade, wielded by Anduin Lothar until his death. It bears the lion of Stormwind near its parry bar.
The inside of a doom horn looks like it has been blackened with a flame, but feels smooth and cool. The sound of this horn freezes the blood in the veins of the enemies.
This libram is a symbol of devoutness to the ideals of the holy light. Its owner proves to be a faithful student of the light and a righteous defender.
This libram is a symbol of guardianship before the ideals of the holy light. Its owner proves to be a strong and righteous fighter for the light.
This libram is a symbol of reckoning before the ideals of the holy light. Its owner proves to be a strong fighter for the light.
This libram is a symbol of righteousness before the ideals of the holy light. Its owner proves to be a faithful student and righteous fighter for the light.
The powerful sound of this horn makes the hearts of the soldiers beat faster.
This character replaced their hand with a blade that may prove useful in battle, as it is no worse than holding a blade.
The remains of the rune stone of Caer Darrow.
The Ring of the Kaldorei Empire.

This golden ring decorated with precious stones is a direct proof of the incredible wealth of the Trollbane family, which they have acquired over many centuries by owning a multitude of mines in the Arathi highlands.
A set of chimes made of human and animal bones connected by cords that glow with an eerie luminescence.
All allies who hear the inspiring rhythms of this drum feel their hearts beat faster and their hands close tighter around their weapons.

The belt of the famed Lion of Stormwind, a great warrior and general under king Llane Wrynn, who leads the armies of Stormwind against many threats and foes.
This mantle used to be a part of the once great Arathian Empire's flag, which the ancestors of the Trollbanes' preserved and wore as a cloak after the empire's fall.
This family relic of the Trollbane dynasty was worn by many outstanding generals. Since Ignaeus Trollbane, military education has been a family pride.
This libram is a symbol of devoutness to the ideals of the holy light. Its owner proves to be a faithful student of the light and a righteous defender.

May you always bring light into dark places.

The violet stones, in which the souls of the unfortunate are imprisoned, are used by warlocks to enhance their twisted, dark magic.
The totem of a tauren chieftain.
With this top hat, you will definitely attract attention to yourself!
